text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate provided a comprehensive legal brief structure as requested. It clearly detailed the key elements of the statutory test (s. 76 CJIA 2008) and the common law test for reasonable force (necessity and proportionality). Crucially, it dedicated a specific section (Section IV) to analysing the impact of an honest but mistaken belief, referencing the core case law supporting this principle, namely R v Williams (Gladstone), Beckford v The Queen, and R v Owino, and linking these to the statutory provisions. The structure and content fully satisfy all components required by the rubric criterion.", "criterion_id": "63ab3c85-b0ca-4a1d-a962-dd86eb3f35b5"}
